conversion_verification.notes: 3D cutaway model shows extruded walls with thickness, visible wall side faces, perceivable room volumes, and an elevated angled view with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls are properly extruded with thickness and clean corners; floors read as a separate plane. Cutaway is clear and interior is visible, though openings/edges are somewhat simplified.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room arrangement matches (living/dining left, bedroom bottom-right, toilet above bedroom, kitchen/utility at top). Some partition/opening placements are simplified and door/window fidelity is weak.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (sofa, table, bed) and placed in the correct spaces; bathroom fixtures appear. Kitchen is simplified and some utility/kitchen details are minimal.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry and clean presentation with consistent materials. Lighting is adequate but slightly flat, and some openings (doors/windows) are not clearly differentiated.

detected_errors.description: Doors and windows from the 2D plan are not clearly modeled/positioned; several wall openings appear missing or ambiguous in the 3D render.
Some internal partitions/openings (notably around toilet/utility circulation) are simplified versus the 2D plan, reducing exact layout fidelity.
Kitchen/utility elements are present but simplified; not all 2D-indicated fixtures/cabinetry are represented.
Rendering/lighting is serviceable but does not strongly emphasize openings and edges, reducing structural legibility.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with largely correct room layout, but door/window placement and some interior partition details are simplified and reduce geometric fidelity.
